intro: Schleichera oleosa, commonly known as the Indian chestnut or the Chinese chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves that are alternate and pinnate. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody fruits containing one or two seeds. Schleichera oleosa is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes. It prefers well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
